text: Goodbye Sousa is a Canadian short documentary film, directed by Tony Ianzelo and released in 1973. It profiles the Newmarket Citizens' Band, one of Canada's oldest active marching bands.Robert Terence Carter, Newmarket: The Heart of York Region. Dundurn Press, 1996. . p. 92. The film won the Canadian Film Award for Best Theatrical Short Film at the 25th Canadian Film Awards in 1971.Maria Topalovich, And the Genie Goes To...: Celebrating 50 Years of the Canadian Film Awards. Stoddart Publishing, 2000. . pp. 93-95. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1973 films Category:Canadian films Category:Best Theatrical Short Film Genie and Canadian Screen Award winners Category:Canadian short documentary films Category:1973 short films Category:National Film Board of Canada short films Category:Films directed by Tony Ianzelo Category:Films shot in Ontario
title: Goodbye Sousa
